comment:
I have to completely disagree with the majority on this. I came into this with biased in favor of Johnny, because I didn't want to believe he'd do the things she wrote in her report, and I've been a huge fan of his since Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas. I wanted to believe she was lying. So for me to listen to this and other information and end up thinking the opposite, is hard for me to swallow. After hearing testimony from previous women Johnny has dated saying he wasn't abusive towards them and the nice things they said about him I was starting to think Amber was a liar and a gold digger. But if she was a gold digger she would have taken his offer in this conversation to keep it private and taken his money. Much cleaner and easier for a gold digger. She wants justice, but she's not recognizing her part in the abuse because of how bad his side of it was if her written report is true. Again this is just my opinion based of what I've seen and heard. She's not very bright it seems, and she's a very emotional person with a lot of anger. I think Amber has had physically abusive relationships in the past and has come to think that it's ok to be physically abusive, which in that case makes her claims pretty weak. I think this may be Johnnys first physically abusive relationship and if her written statement was true then he eventually took it to another level. I think he knew it was wrong and unhealthy and eventually tried to remedy it by removing himself from the situations. 

But He's saying whatever he thought he needed to, to make this go away. When she points out moments of abuse he doesn't defend himself because there's nothing to defend, he either knows he did it, or is psychology damaged enough to not see it that way or less than it was.

I have been the witness in a case against a family member who was abusive to a women. Said women also said and did abusive things but not even close to the extreme my family member did. I've seen it first hand, heard both sides arguments in private and in front of each other, and went through a court case that ended in said family members incarceration for abusing the victim.

What I'm hearing in this is that they were both abusive. But also that Amber may have exscalated them on some or all of the occasions. It seems he's the on that recorded this conversation so of course he's going to be more calm and collected than normal. I believe He walked out of the room at the end to lose his shit and didn't want it on the recording. Which tells me he also is the one leaking information so he lied to her about that. That's all speculation on my part though. Also side note, I'm pretty sure it's illegal in most states to record a phone conversation without telling the other party they are being recorded. 

Unfortunately for Amber it does sound like she did also contributed to the abuse, verbally and physically. That she does lie about her abuse in the relationship, so maybe she does lie about the abuse he's done. Which is not going to end well for either of them. The things is he did give me the firm belief that he has become unhinged behind closed doors and when not being recorded during this relationship. They were toxic for each other, which lead him down a road it sounds like he hasn't been before or at least not to this extreme. They both contributed to the abuse and allowed it to go on for too long.

I do believe Johnny is the one that finally started removing himself from these situations which was the right thing to do. So he obviously at point recognized how unhealthy it was getting for both of them and it seems this infuriated Amber more than the supposed abuse. Or when he realized these abusive altercations could possibly have legal ramifications he made the decision to leave before they exscalated further.

My relative was a great person before his  abusive actions that landed him in prison. But he let drugs and alcohol consume him, and became violent and psychotic. The similarities of the relationship and the allegations between the case I witnessed and the conversations and details of this one are very similar.

His tone, and the way he speaks. Her emotionally losing it. The hurtful things they both say and how they say it. I feel bad for both of them and that neither of them ended it sooner. Some souls just don't mix and make good people do stupid things. Drugs and alcohol do not help either IF either of them were abusing them.

comment: Okay well first off I've been in therapy a long ass time from being in relationships just like this. Number one he was recording her so he knew that it was going to be for his protection so he was going to try and make himself sound good. That being said both of them are morons. I've lost a lot of respect for Johnny Depp for even messing with somebody this immature. God I was so disappointed when him and his wife got divorced. I love her so much but hey that's their business, it's all good. But if I had to sum this situation up sounds like a love story to me. I've been in situations like this that were inflamed with passion. You're in a haze where abuse is not abuse, it's passion, you're enjoying your interactions even the bad ones. Then they're breaking up and now it's accusations lol. Oh lord it was brutal but I guess it was wonderful too. It had to be since I kept doing it repeatedly. But clearly they were abusing each other and I know their sex was amazing. This has all the markings of fantastic. Hopefully they raise their standards after this because you can't keep doing relationships like that over and over again. I've done that and it's just too much. You have to just forgive yourself and let that life go. Things get super boring after that but hey maybe it's better this way.

comment: So I am a recent survivor of DV and this has unearthed a lot of shite. It gave me this anxious, sick twisting feeling in the pit of my stomach. The same feeling I get when my abusive ex would hit me then later say he didn't. He would tell me I'm lying and crazy even though I had a busted lip. He got angry at me for telling him his assaults is what caused my water to break 5 months pregnant and lose our daughter. I loved him and thought I could reason with him. The feeling he gave me is the same feeling I get hearing Amber. Johnny is really strong, I was driven insane. I am only now sifting through that year of my life understanding it for what it was. An abuser, a narcissist a professional manipulator who preys on kind empathetic people to use and put up with there shite. Sucking the energy and life out of you. That's what Amber is. She is like my abusive  ex so much so its horroring. I hope he gets justice.  I hope this raises awareness on the tactics abusers use. I hope anyone in a toxic relationship realizes that the other person knows what they're doing and are playing you. Your empathy, love and kindness is wasted on them. They'll use it as a weapon against you. Get out, get free. I could've been killed. Johnny could've been killed.

comment:
Lots of comments here that do not correctly identify what is going on.

AH is an unaware Narcissist. She doesn‚Äôt know what she is and believes she is a good person. It‚Äôs a facade.

Approx 1 in 6 people are Narcs. This should be taught in schools so we can identify these dangerous, emotionally compromised & manipulative individuals. What does this mean and how does it manifest in everyday life? They have the following behaviours/characteristics:

No emotional empathy
Sense of Entitlement 
Hyper-sensitivity to sense of control
No accountability / Blame shifting
Think in black and white, no compromises or shades of grey
Use Triangulation, objects and people, as a way of asserting control and manipulating
No boundary recognition 
No conscience, no sense of remorse or guilt
Dishonesty and lies to achieve control & fuel, ie positive and/or negative emotional responses
Future faking and re-writing history

For more info search for HG Tudor on YouTube...

comment: First I wanna thank you for the wonderful job that you have done on your videos covering every aspect of the entire thing. This is the first time I believe that I‚Äôm commenting after all these years, but I myself was in a 15 year horrific torturous marriage. I was abused physically mentally emotionally and I as well defended my ex always. Last November was when I finally was able to be free. All I wanted to walk away with was what was left with my dignity, and when I came into the relationship with 20 years prior - A car, which I had one in my name already, my personal effects and that was it I was going to take the dog that we had for 10 years because I was the only one who took care of it and the bastard came in and stole them from me right before I was leaving. So yeah I understand completely, and I feel how Johnny feels because I was there. I was there in that Fog of a make-believe place that the abuser put you in in your mind. And that‚Äôs why when he said ‚Äúyou know I loved you for so many years all these years I‚Äôve always loved you, but you were never there you weren‚Äôt real‚Äú he‚Äôs not wrong. Her body was there the person was there but the fantasy of the marriage in a relationship, no that was that was absolutely not real. The fighting oh make no mistake that was real. But the love there was no love from her she only told him what he wanted to hear so she could get what she wanted and then manipulate him and twist them all up. My heart goes out to that man I would give anything to be able just to give them a hug and tell him that he probably just have survived one of the hardest and most coolest things a human being to go through. So Johnny here is to you love... if our paths ever do cross may we smile and laugh over conversation and wine. See you in my dreams. Until then much love and respect to you ‚ù§Ô∏è

stop interpreting stuff in your own way. She said that nobody is going to believe him these fucked up stories, but why did she say that?

After all what she's done to him he still wanted to protect her. He knows exactly what her plan is and he knows that she won't  win this fight, because all she's telling are lies. comment:
I'm confused. I've been neutral towards this whole situation. Didn't know who was to blame, didn't care enough to listen to anyone's point of view until evidence came out. Now it's time, apparently. Though I don't understand how these recordings came to be. I was under the impression that it might be whenever people call one another, but clearly Johny's voice was still being recorded as the line "disconnected". I can't help but find it highly suspicious... was it recorded because HE had a recorder going on? If so, anything he says is irrelevant, for a couple reasons... he can act in a way that helps his case, and he is a hell of a great actor.

Can someone shed a light in this and help me understand how those recordings work? Because so far, I was buying into the whole "she is not a victim" talk, but this part of the audio didn't seem very honest. Not saying she was right, I've seen some compromising stuff that are very telling about her true character. But I can't help but feel like there's something fishy about these recordings too.

comment:
Diese Frau ist ein Narzisst. Sie hat ihm gezeigt wie sich der Himmel anf√ºhlt, um ihn dann in die H√∂lle zu schicken. Und das immer und immer wieder. Wenn man jemand so sehr liebt, und einmal dieses unglaubliche Gef√ºhl mit dieser Person hatte m√∂chte man immer wieder dahin  zur√ºck. Egal wie weh einem die Person tut. Man trinkt Alkohol, nimmt Drogen, um es auszuhalten. Man dreht langsam selber durch, weil man alles probiert damit es funktioniert. Aber immer wenn es wieder den Himmel gibt, wird man von der Person wieder in die H√∂lle geschickt. Sie manipuliert, l√ºgt, macht eine schlecht, gibt einem das Gef√ºhl man w√§re verr√ºckt oder selber ein schlechter Mensch. Man kann es schwer beschreiben. Aber das ist psychischer Missbrauch, auch oft verbunden mit physischem. Vllt hat er sie mal weg gesto√üen als sie immer und immer wieder auf ihn los ist. Mit L√ºgen, Schreien, F√§usten... Diese Art jemanden fertig zu machen, muss man erst erlebt haben... Diese Art von Missbrauch ist f√ºr mich schlimmer als jede physische. Sie zerst√∂rt dein Weltbild, l√§sst dich Die Welt nicht mehr verstehen. Der Mensch den du √ºber alles liebt redet dir Sachen ein, l√§sst dich denken du warst Mist, erz√§hlt dir ins Gesicht Sachen √ºber dich selber die nicht wahr sind.... Typisch Narzisst....Hier ist er das Opfer. Keine Frage das es toxisch war und vllt hat er dadurch auch viel zu viel Drogen genommen und wurde selber verr√ºckt in den Momenten. Aber als Opfer. Manipuliert, ausgenutzt, abh√§ngig von Ihrer Liebe.... Ich hoffe die Wahrheit kommt ans Licht. F√ºr alle die diese Art von Missbrauch erleben mussten. Psychisch manipuliert und fertig gemacht zu werden. Immer wieder weg geschmissen zu werden, als w√§re man Dreck, und dann wieder s√º√ü zu sein....
This woman is a narcissist. She showed him what heaven feels like, only to send him to hell. And that over and over again. If you love someone so much, and once had this incredible feeling with this person you always want to go back there. No matter how much the person hurts you. You drink alcohol, take drugs to endure it. You slowly go crazy yourself, because you try everything to make it work. But whenever there is heaven again, the person sends you back to hell. They manipulate, lie, make you feel bad, give you the feeling that you are crazy or a bad person. It's hard to describe. But this is psychological abuse, often combined with physical abuse. He may have pushed her away once when she went at him over and over again. With lies, screams, fists... You have to experience this kind of abuse first... This kind of abuse is worse than any physical one for me. It destroys your world view, makes you not understand the world anymore. The person you love above all else tells you things, makes you think you were crap, tells you things about yourself to your face that are not true.... Typical narcissist....Here he is the victim. No question that it was toxic and maybe he took too many drugs and went crazy himself in those moments. But as a victim. Manipulated, exploited, dependent on your love.... I hope the truth comes to light. For all who had to experience this kind of abuse. Being psychologically manipulated and beaten down. Being thrown away again and again as if you were dirt, and then being sweet again

comment:
This is so much like my Brothers abusive relationship it‚Äôs terrifying!! All high level narcissists are the same & they can never change because it‚Äôs not a mental illness, it‚Äôs basically just a shitty personality where they deliberately seek out timid, kind men they think they can manipulate, abuse & control!! My Brother is completely trapped in a abusive relationship with his kids & the law doesn‚Äôt give a shit when it comes to abused men!! Plus she has him absolutely brainwashed into thinking he‚Äôs an abuser too cause whenever she beats the shit outta him while he‚Äôs holding their BABY & if he pushes her away or blocks her punches cause she‚Äôs about to hit their baby too, she screams ‚Äúabuse‚Äù, it‚Äôs pathetic!! She once called me yelling ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sick of your brother f**ing abusing me‚Äù, I‚Äôd had enough & told her ‚Äúblocking your punches doesn‚Äôt count as abuse you narcissistic bitch, you can‚Äôt brainwash anyone else, no one even your own family can‚Äôt stand to be around you for a reason... I hope he f+%^ing kills you to be honest so at least those my poor Nephews you‚Äôve destroyed will have half a chance‚Äù. I‚Äôve honestly never met such a disgusting excuse for a human being in all my life, even villains in movies got nothing on this slime & sadly my Brothers not the first soul she‚Äôs destroyed, he‚Äôs just the only one she was able to trap with kids & she tells him all the time, if he dares gets a job, leaves the house without her, talks on the phone without it on speaker so she can hear or even thinks about leaving her, she‚Äôll kill the kids. Even tells him ‚Äú& you‚Äôll be the one left to explain to all the family why the kids are dead because of you!!‚Äù. Can you freaking believe that?!? Just about every neighbour they‚Äôve ever had have called the Cops at certain times & outright said they‚Äôve seen & heard HER constantly physically abusing him, many have even said they‚Äôve even seen her do it with the kids in his arms!! She even beat the shit outta him right out the front of the hospital when they were taking their 2nd baby home while he had the newborn baby AND their 1yr old in his arms cause he‚Äôs so terrified of his sad excuse for a Mother that he was clinging to my Brother... All because she hadn‚Äôt gotten to smoke any weed for 24hrs while having the baby!! She smokes bongs all day every day including while pregnant & breast feeding & she literally only breast feeds because it‚Äôs ‚Äúcheaper‚Äù too, pumping those babies with whatever she wants, it‚Äôs disgusting!! I‚Äôve never heard of an abused man case that has as many different people reported on seeing things as my brother yet the law won‚Äôt step in, not a single person in authority has ever stepped in & said ‚Äúleave with your kids mate & we‚Äôll make sure she doesn‚Äôt get her hands on them & kill them out of spite‚Äù, it‚Äôs pathetic, this is how kids die FFS!!!! 

Sorry for the rant but men being abused makes me so angry!! We as society need to STOP automatically believing every female with flapping gums!! I‚Äôm a female myself & I say that!! Men have nowhere to turn for help & the statistics are SO high now, WAY too high & is as society have contributed to that. It needs to stop & although I‚Äôm gutted to know Johnny Depp is another poor man completely victimised at the hands of a narcissistic b*%%^, at the same time I‚Äôm so glad such a undeniable case of it is out in the public eye cause maybe it‚Äôll make more people think & maybe bring in some much needed laws & help for men!! Men matter too!! I‚Äôm disgusted he lost his job with no proof & now look, everywhere & everyone further victimised the victim!! I can‚Äôt imagine how Johnny must‚Äôve felt for all that time he was wrongly accused, knowing the whole time what really went on & knowing full well society would probably never believe him. comment:
There's a real problem in our society with gender bias against men, and many people don't realize it until they look at a situation between a female & male couple, then switch the gender, then they see how biased they are - a great example is the case of Christopher Watts. It's crazy how so many people totally ignore what's obvious about someone's behavior, and think they need to rely on typical "evidence", like the type of evidence that comes from an investigation. For some reason, in our society, people ignore a person's obvious mental health and behavior, people are so afraid of "diagnosing", and these same ignorant people condemn others when they recognize & point out other's mentally disordered behavior, saying that they aren't "doctors", so cannot diagnose - you dont need to be a psychiatrist to recognize this dangerous behavior, it is natural, even toddlers can see these behaviors. 

Just listening to this conversation ALONE tells us everything we need to know about both of them - Johnny is the voice of reason (for real, not fake, with integrity) trying to diffuse her, but her emotions and rhetoric is that of an abusive person, physical and emotional. She's using all of the tactics that narcissists use. Her excuse about being a 115 lb female is laughable, weak, & ignorant. 

This is why our society needs to realize that verbal & emotional abuse hurts even more than physical abuse does, and does even more damage, so it's not always wrong, and definitely natural for people who defend themselves, yes, even physically, when they are being verbally & emotionally abused - even trained & experienced psychiatrists & psychologists, with everything they know, are not immune from being hurt with words and emotional abuse, and MOST IMPORTANTLY, people who are abusive should expect their victims to defend themselves in any way they can. In other words, when someone is abusing someone, in any way, their victim should not be criminally charged for defending themselves.

comment:
"I loved you for so many fucking years but you know what? You didn't exist.  You don't exist.  You're not there you're not there.  You are a driving made up thing in my head."

He definitely doesn't seem like the abuser here.  This really stuck out to me.  That's exactly how it's like being in a relationship with an abuser.  The person you fell in love with doesn't really exist.  They pretend to be something they're not so you fall for them then they completely change.  But they don't change how they act in front of family and friends.  It's when they're alone with you.  So if you try to talk to anyone about it you seem crazy.  She's clearly been painting herself as the victim here.  Abuse is about controlling the other person.  If he was beating her he wouldn't have stayed this calm on the phone while she was threatening him.  But not once did he try to tear her down or insult her.  He barely raised his voice.  Someone who is abusive to their partner isn't going to take that.  The majority of abusers don't see themselves as in the wrong.   They will go to ridiculous ends to rationalize hitting their partners so they're right in their minds.  If he was abusive he wouldn't have just decided to end the call.  He would have argued.
author: Katie Sterling

comment:
I've been in a relationship with someone this toxic..

I will never forget when my ex (year long relationship) accused me of cheating when I'd didn't. At 24 years old I was working every day and night to pay the bills and was getting 3 hours of sleep every night from working 3 jobs. She was going to school and living off of my income. I got tired of it and I said "if you're going to falsely accuse me of always cheating than I might as well do it anyways".

She pulled a knife on me in my own kitchen and told me I wouldn't live to tell the story. She even asked me "even if I was to stab you in 'self defense' who do you think the cops would believe you as a man or me?". She even started fake crying with a knife pointed at my stomach while I was doing dishes and started talking to me as if she was speaking to cops afterwards.. saying things  in a sobbing voice like "he was coming at me and I didn't know what to do".

I then planned my escape that weekend afterwards, and moved out.. bought a gun (carry it on me 24/7) and have never looked back. But all I remember thinking all the time is there's women out there who are this crazy, abusive and hide that they think this way. They will hurt or threaten anyone to get what they want.

Still to this day my current wife tells me I have issues trusting people (like friends and family). We even reflected and it took me about a year or two to properly fall asleep overnight in the same bed together since we've started. I always tell her you would too after what I've dealt with.
author: Specter Green

comment:
First of all...id like to say that i am a johnny depp fan and enjoy his movies. However i am not stupid enough to believe that the guy is some angel. Sure, she's certainly a headcase, but Johnny is no innocent. 
He's obviously got some kind of wierd issues. your all blaming amber....but its abmoral for him to ask someone to cut him. the guy needs help. and you just cant blame her. he could have left her anytime. and he's got a history of violence with other women . he was arrested in the 90's when he was with kate moss for destroying a hotel room while fighting with her. he was also arrested for attacking a papparazi with a stick. and he seems proud of it. 
so stop defending him like he's some helpless victim. hes NOT!
and of course his ex wife is defending him....she doesnt want to lose all that alimony and child support. and winona ryder was 30 years ago....he was a different guy back then. drugs and alcohol changed this guy, and going through middle aged and aging can change a person a lot too. 
and the guy was a middle aged man who left his wife and kids to be with this young actress nearly half his age. what the hell did he expect.  he got what he deserved as far as im concerned. its all his karma coming back to him. of course all she was after was his money and fame. 
Johnny needs to grow up. he's pushing 60, and he walks around dressing an acting like an adolescent school boy.
He needs to date a women closer to his own age, have a mature relationship, and stop boozing and drugging it up like a sailor on leave. 
this guy was a well respected actor in one of the most successful movie series of all time, and he threw it all away and ruined his career for a piece of tail!!!! what a fool!

This is whats scary in this day an age, in a calculated girl/woman who could screw over a guy like this with physical and emotional abuse (can and does happen vice versa too). It shows how horrible the media and legal systems are. 
Now think how if this is happening to someone famous like Johnny and with his wealth being able to at least fight this. What happens to the avg person who may not be able to.

comment:
I don't pride myself on being a good judge of character because I'm not, but I can completely read the innocence from Johnny. He's so calm and trying his best to be peaceable in the face of an evil creature. He doesn't spend too much time talking about what happened to him unless it gets brought up, but insists that he loves her no matter what.

However... the worst part about it is she's an excellent actress, very convincing. But this is a classic sociopathic behavior right there. Sociopaths are narcissistic manipulators and are VERY good at it, especially when you've been doing it for so long. She's trying to ruin one of my favourite childhood actors and I cannot stand the fact that it's working...

author: Perzival3000

comment:
Uhhh. Yeah. This sounds exactly like how my dad's crazy ex would talk when they were making up after she had apologized and her self-hate was turning into pride, and she started with the "But YOU... you were also... uh... there. Existing", convincing herself that she was the victim and was totally in the right. 

And he'd have that same resignated, "Yes dear, sure I almost murdered you by ducking your punches and leaving the room saying I've had enough," tone of voice. 

Thrice, random strangers called the cops as she beat him.
Meanwhile she's so caught up in the lie that she once calls the cops on him and says he threatened to kill her when in fact he had said he was breaking up with her.

So. Yeah. Yeah I feel like I have some expertise here because this is *eerily* similar. 

That frantic voice, trying to snag on something in another person, hoping someone will feel pity and affirm their lies to themselves. I can see her *eyes* dammit. She might actually be wrapping herself into a comforting blanket of lies and believing herself, the way she's sounding. Especially with friends around to tell her she's in the right. She might even pass a lie-detector test after four years defending her stance.

comment:
I don't really know the whole story here, but it sounds to me like they are BOTH wrong.
So many people are on Johnny's side because they like him. He's a very popular actor. He's an individual. He's eccentric, charming and cool. People obviously find him endearing. But that doesn't mean he isn't capable of being a difficult person to have an intimate, real-life relationship with. He very well may have behaved in a toxic, manipulative, abusive way towards Amber. That doesn't make her an innocent victim either, but to make it out that she's evil is just unrealistic. 
Clearly, they are both quite complicated and at a breaking point here. 
In relationship situations such as this one, sadly both parties are to blame. They provoke each other; they have become incompatible and can't find patience, compassion or selflessness for each other anymore. Not to mention that they are both performers professionally - what must that do to someone's ego and insecurities?
Anyway, what the hell am I doing here? It really isn't any of my business.

comment:
So, I saw Amber be very untruthful.  She is definitely not being truthful.  But... why,  when she was accusing him of all the horrific things she said he did... why wouldn't he say... "what are you talking about? I never did any of those things to you."  Why wouldn't he say that right then.  Why wouldn't he say "you are completely delusional and where are you coming up with that?" That's what I would say.  Instead,  he is just silent.  He doesn't deny it in the video/audio. 
That's what grabbed me here.  Even though most everything I see from Amber seems unbelievable.  She is unbelievable.  But,  I  do question why he wouldn't dispute her in the actual conversation about it. If that was me, I would immediately say... That didn't happen! I think the abuse was probably on both sides.  She may be the aggressor,  but some kind of abuse was on both sides.  That's normally the way abuse goes anyway.

comment:
You (and many others) may have misinterpreted what Amber was trying to say between 5:21 and 7:21. She's claiming that she has so much evidence of abuse against Depp that no one would incorrectly believe she has been faking abuse and planning to falsely accuse him for years. You took this to mean that she HAS in fact been planning it for years but she is not saying that. She backs this up by saying "I'm not asking for money and have nothing financial to gain from it" (so why would she fake it). It is confusing because she does explain in depth how someone would fake evidence (so she may have thought about it) but she does not admit to doing that herself. She is saying that she actually has all that evidence.

I'm not denying that she is the abuser, or that she falsely accused him, but she is not some genius criminal mastermind that is faking evidence. If that were true, some of these fake abuse pictures would likely have come out by now. Most likely, she doesn't have most of the evidence she claimed to have, and is lying about it to scare Depp. It is still an intimidation tactic and doesn't make her a good person.

comment: I really hope the UK justice system understands the damage this psycho broad could have caused for regular, non celebrity women and men. How many, today, are in a dangerous relationship with someone who is hurting them on a daily basis? How many, thanks to this, are thinking, well, no one is believing her. If I speak out or seek help, why are they going to believe me? I can almost guarantee, 100 %, had this been back in my day, living through the hell, I wouldn‚Äôt have spoken out. Thankfully, society has woken up and realized that DV is real and people get hurt and killed daily. I was in it a a few years before it became a social subject. I just hope anyone in this situation, realizes that there is so much evidence proving Johnny is not a violent wife abuser. Don‚Äôt be afraid to speak out. Keep a diary. Write everything down, record everything when possible. Don‚Äôt let another person treat you less than. You deserve better. No one has the right to lay hands on another person. It is just not necessary. Violence will never fix a problem. I don‚Äôt recognize the stupid girl I was back then. I almost feel sorry for any man dumb enough to try and hit me. Johnny is not guilty of the heinous acts claimed by AH. This should be a lesson to everyone. Be very careful who you allow into your life. There are some twisted people out there. I‚Äôve heard just about every story possible. It‚Äôs truly scary for the genuine victims. Women like this can be worse than the most violent man. Greed is a horrible disease in itself.

comment:
Narcissistic abuse

Lovebomb the victim, give them everything they want to see in the beginning, you gain their trust, make them feel so comfortable with you that youre on cloud 9. Mirror whatever it is that they want. make them feel like god. That releases huge amounts of dopamine in the brain

Then Devalue the victim. Start fights, gaslight them, blameshift, take no accountability. Alter their perception. The victim is still in the lovebomb dopamine state of mind being around you makes them feel good. that they will believe the little abuses you commit against them. Afterall, why would this person who has treated me so well hurt me right? I must not be performing correctly now. I must do better or surrender to their will so i can get that dopamine back. This stress releases cortisol which is a stress hormone and when the abuser feels that you are getting close to breaking they do the lovebomb phase again. Victim then goes ‚Äúoh thank god theres that person i knew in the beginning‚Äù

Then the cycle repeats itself depending on the victim and how much emotion and attention they get from it. Over time the lovebomb gets shorter and the devalue gets longer. Over time this messed with your oxytocin (bonding hormone) literally making you addicted to the abuser. The combination of these hormones being released in your brain create what is called a ‚Äútrauma bond‚Äù

This makes it easier for the abuser to destroy you and try and control you. You may want nothing to do with the abuser and you think youre in love but thats the trauma bonding keeping you locked in. The person you fell in love with never existed. It was a mask. That is what JD meant when he said ‚Äúyou never existed‚Äù or something along those lines.

These people target good people like JD in the beginning with the full intentions of destruction.

comment: My mother-in-law counseled battered women for over 20 years and she always told me, ‚Äúabuse has a pattern.‚Äù Look at the past relationships of both. Johnny has drunkenly torn up some hotel rooms but he‚Äôs never ever been accused or even whispered about abusing his partners. And his partners willingly came forward to say so. Amber Heard on the other hand abused her former partner to the point of law enforcement getting involved. Yes her partner tried to say it was a misunderstanding, which is also very common in abusive relationships. And her emotional hostage-taking in these calls and the way she plays this poor guy‚Äîshe‚Äôs classic borderline personality disorder. Men are victims too. I believe victims‚Äîeven when they happen to be men. If she was so afraid of him, she would not be continuing to call him and threaten to ‚Äúout‚Äù him in public and in court. She‚Äôd be too afraid. So sad. I hope he gets away from her and never falls for her ‚Äúpoor me‚Äù story again. He saw the truth briefly in this call‚Äîshe was not really who he thought she was. He was in love with a fantasy‚Äîshe‚Äôs not real. Run Johnny run and don‚Äôt look back.

comment: Amber is quite a troubling character. This is like a game to her. She's not interested in uncovering the truth or in the basis tenants of fairness. She continually paints herself as the victim and then tries to leverage her (perceived) believably factor to extort JD. She never takes responsibility or accountability for her own actions. She literally hit JD in the face with a closed fix, and severed his finger (among other things) and straight lied about it and somehow rationalized it away...."oh, it doesn't count if I punch you,  because you're bigger than me" (wow, that's some airtight logic) Seems to lack empathy and exhibits extremely arrogant + entitled behavior. Not sure why she assumed the general public was going to side with her over JD....why, because she's a women and can 'act' hysterical? She can't seem to remember basic details of these abusive encounters, and often resorts to these faux display of hysteria as a distraction mechanism (lets just say she's not an improv actor, and can't think quickly on her feet) I mean, she clearly did not prep enough for this abusive wife 'role'. Should have reenacted these imaginary encounters/events. JD is 57 years old, surely at least one former partner or friend can attest to his physically abusive behavior....but nope, nothing but radio silence. Amber, on the other hand has been previously arrested on assault charges. People in general have pretty good bullshit detectors. She seems to be an opportunist with no moral compass, who is willing to say and do anything to get what she wants  (or maybe what she thinks she "deserves"). These are some of the worst personality traits...please don't let her good looks fool you. Sociopaths come in all shapes and sizes... wouldn't doubt that she had daddy issues growing up (something clearly f**ed her up). She may have underestimated how this would play out (as in people not believing her "story"). Should have accepted the olive branch JD extended to her. I suspect her acting career may be over. It's funny, I'm trying to imagine this first time JD had the thought..hmmm.. something may be a bit off with this chick. I mean, she was literally living the dream: she was an actress married to a super famous actor, lived in a massive house in a remote scenic location (with various other properties around the world), had connections with other celebrities (you know if that's your thing), and she pretty much had the resources to do whatever she wanted to do. If you can't be satisfied with that sort of lifestyle....then what's missing?

comment:
*THANK YOU,* for this and the other videos you‚Äôve created, meticulously and clearly placing all of the facts on the table. As a survivor of years of domestic abuse, stalking, harassment and assault, I cannot fully extrapolate just how disgusting and despicable I find Amber Heard. I am a woman and a survivor of abuse from both men AND women, both as a child and as an adult. It‚Äôs 2020, and people *STILL* cannot believe or don‚Äôt want to believe that a woman is capable of being the abuser, the aggressor, the toxic one. While it‚Äôs true that, historically, men are more often abusers, that does *NOT* negate the *FACT* that women CAN & DO perpetrate abuse. 

Also, it has been my experience and understanding that female abusers are often more manipulative and diabolical in their planning and execution of abuse (whether the abuse is directed at a romantic partner, a child or children, colleagues in the workplace, family, friends, etc). 

I doubt that Johnny Depp is totally innocent of any fuck ups, because the man is HUMAN, and ALL humans are fallible. But I‚Äôve NO DOUBT that Johnny Depp is *INNOCENT* of these allegations. He is nearly 60 years old. Nearly my Mom‚Äôs age. If he were an abuser, I could bet the world that abusive tendencies and actions would‚Äôve happened DECADES prior to his relationship and marriage with Amber Heard. His exes have been unanimous in their testimony that Johnny was never abusive towards them. *NEVER.* Are we to believe that the man suddenly became this woman-hating monster in middle age, only after he became involved with Amber?! My eyes are rolling so hard. This woman sounds like she has borderline personality disorder, is a narcissist and possibly, is a sociopath. It really pisses me off that Amber Heard is attempting to manipulate a system that is STILL not very kind to victims and survivors of abuse. She makes it harder on everyone and she doesn‚Äôt care. She is using using her feminine attributes, her platform, her (and more likely much of his) money and the criminal justice system to create chaos, confusion, hurt, and cause destruction. Shameless, calculating, ugly human being she is.

comment: When Amber first came forward saying that Johnny abused her, I‚Äôm ashamed to say that I was angry. I wanted Johnny to be fired from Fantastic Beasts franchise and written off. Then more info came out and I though that maybe they were both abusive to each other. But now I‚Äôve actually watched videos, listened to recordings, and testimonies of them both I am sickened by her blatant narcissism and hatefulness. A narcissist often uses the truth to manipulate and mask themselves; ‚Äúwhat, you think I would actually put makeup on to fake injuries?‚Äù ‚ÄúYou think that I would plan this over a few years to make sure I had evidence against you?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy would I make up you abusing me?‚Äù ... and then the manipulation; ‚ÄúI was 115 pounds, who would believe that I abused you? I couldn‚Äôt even push you over. You wanna come forward saying that you were beat up by me? Yeah, no one will believe you.‚Äù It‚Äôs all there. I hope Johnny gets the justice he deserves. When he says ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt love you, I loved the version of you I had in my head‚Äù THAT IS EXACTLY HOW NARCISSISTS HOLD ON TO THEIR VICTIMS. She made him believe that she was perfect and he was flawed. Not only has she jeopardised him with this story, she has also jeopardised and belittled all the domestic abuse survivors in the world. How selfish and cruel.

comment: Being in family law for years, I can assure both parties, the courts would rather have people reach agreements. They don‚Äôt care. We are all just a case number. They deal with so many every day. It‚Äôs really not worth the money, no matter how much you have. Lying about being abused, and selling your story to the trash mags doesn‚Äôt help either. It is obvious Amber is not an innocent little angel. Johnny probably has no more issues than the rest of us. If he was really an abuser, this would have happened a long time ago. She is only diminishing all the real abuse victims in our country. She should be ashamed. She‚Äôs worried about her reputation??? Wow, really, try being honest. Stop labeling Johnny as some psycho abuser. If you throw a punch at a man, he should not have to just take it. Make up does a lot good and bad. I‚Äôve never seen you in any movie, but if your acting skills are anything like you show in this case, I‚Äôm pretty sure I don‚Äôt want to see any movie with you in it. I already know enough about you, don‚Äôt want to waste any more time. Johnny deserves better. His exes wouldn‚Äôt be coming to his defense if he had hit or abused them. Having escaped from a couple of violent relationships, I can promise that if any of this was true, she would have left a long time ago. Obviously, this supposed violence only happened with you. Hmm, that speaks volumes. I listened to these stories for hours every day for years. You are a liar. Once upon a time in Amber land, blah blah blah blah !!! What a disgrace.

AMBER HEARD, Regarding the Poop-gate incident:
1. She blames the dogs

comment: It's obvious that he is patient and willing to find a way to fix this and keeps his cool through most of it. Nobody else who knows him has ever come forward that he had been abusive in any way, be it physically, emotionally or mentally, actually most people describe him as being mellow and generous of himself. Is he eccentric ? Yes. Does he have an extravagant life style, yes. But they still can't find anyone that says he has ever been remotely abusive to them. On the other hand, every single time I hear her voice, she does everything possible to try and escalate things. She suffers from borderline personality, I know what I'm talking about, years ago I had to deal with a girlfriend who spent alot of time and effort to make me look bad and I had never done anything to her other than not being there every single time she expected me to be. She hated my friends and continuously talk bad against them but then moment I told her I was done with her, she started befriending my friends, chatting with them, buying them coffee at coffee shops and naturally saying nice things about me, always followed by "but's", she was on a fishing expedition to see if she could find a sympathetic ear among my friends, she didn't find any and it was all reported to me, the only sympathetic ear she found was someone who I thought was my friend and who bought some music instruments of mine, from here believe it or not, while I was away for couple days. She did all sorts o crazy shit to me. I have a son with that person, the whole time she was with me, she always asured me she was on the pill, it was not true. I only found out she was pregnant few weeks after I left her, then more torture started naturally as I felt compelled to get near her again as there was a child involved, biggest mistake of my life.  Oh crap, there I go reliving this shit again hehe. Well anyways, I think Amber is just as toxic as this woman who was part of my life at some point.

author: Just Frame

comment:
I've been a criminal defence lawyer for over 10 years and I've got four things to say about this situation:
1. Most people (which happens to be mostly men) accused of domestic violence are guilty, messed up individuals with serious personality disorders.
2. It's nevertheless a fact that some accusers really do make this shit up (they also tend to have personality disorders). 
3. The criminal justice system in the UK (I can't speak for other jurisdictions but imagine they're not dissimilar) is biased in favour of the accuser.
3. Everything I've heard about this case, particularly these recorded conversations, leads me to believe Amber Heard was the abusive one in this relationship, and that it's not a grey "six of one, half a dozen of the other" situation at all. I will be very surprised if an English court doesn't find in Johnny Depp's favour

comment:
Amber clearly has a cluster-B disorder. Dealt with people like her and the mess in their head is so weird, freaky and scary it is impossible to try to understand them, talk to them or reason with them. They will ALWAYS be the victim, they are the devil in disguise, evil craziness hiding in plain sight and after living with them for a while you start losing your mind yourself. Trauma bonded, stressed out, traumatized, confused by all the gaslighting, exhausted by their word salads and unexpected behaviour, the constant projection and accusations, pit downs.. you end up walking on eggshells, feeling extremely tired and depleted of energy... your emotions all over the place...
You know they will overstep your boundaries and hurt you and that they have no boundaries themselves, thus are capable of the worst emotional, physical,  financial and verbal abuse while making out YOU are the one doing it all, talking behind your back, smearing you, triangulating.. still, once you love one of them it is hard to let go.. they don‚Äôt love, they use and abuse, but the victim often really loves or believes in the perpetrator.. ugh.. exhausting..  being or dealing with one is like an endless mad polka dance from hell...those type people are THE WORST!! only remedy is : NO CONTACT, do NOT engage.

comment: 20:47 . This. This moment is ALL YOU NEED to see who is lying here. A very, very simple question. 3 seconds of silence.  She was searching her memory banks for her next move (obviously a 'Yes' or 'No' answer would be out of the question) Notice that she then re-asks the question to him. This is buying her time. He confirms the question. AND ANOTHER 3 SECONDS OF SILENCE. If you need  6 seconds to evaluate if you have physically abused someone, you probably have. But on top of that, notice she immediately brings up the weight comparison. She's deflecting. He catches it. And then she gets more vindictive, implying that because she cannot completely manhandle him, it is not abuse. "Have I ever been able to knock you off your feet?" <- This means 1) She has done SOMETHING to him before 2) She is asking him that, to confirm, which is also highly typical for abuse -"See, it can't be that bad, I never even knocked you off your feet." (Think back to if you ever accidentally made someone cry as kids because you roughhoused a little too rough. Downplaying it is the first step if you have the wrath of adult supervision looming.) And back to the call, it has now been more than 30 seconds and she still hasn't answered. She's only attempted to muddy the waters, stirring and throwing dirt. The way you try to convince people AND defend yourself speak volumes.

comment:
Quick first note, *"Riley Keough"* would make a great replacement for Aquaman 2  *"Mera"*  character. 

The gender bias is strong with Amber Heard. Had she been a man, he would of been fired ASAP. 
Wait, it did happen, the actor's name is Johnny Depp. He was dismissed/fired and lost future projects due to Amber Heard's false allegations/accusations. His reputation took a huge hit and his name was defamed to the highest degrees for a woman's greed. The fact that so many people still support Amber Heard after all the audio leaks we've heard and videos (deposition being 1 of them) totally baffles me. This is a perfect example of elitist gender bias, women must be believed at all cost because it's PC and men need to be destroyed without due process. Whatever happened about "innocent until proven guilty?" 

The courts need to treat Amber Heard the same way they would treat a man and send a clear message that this is totally unacceptable and there's consequences for women just as same as for men. She deserves to be fired and lose future projects just like her false accusations hurt Johnny Depp's career and loss of potential future projects he had going so therefore since she's the proven abuser and even manufactured false evidence based on her lies, so now that the truth is out, she should be treated as such and be put through the grinder just like Johnny was due to her false accusations. Amber Heard has hurt true victims of abuse and assaults because people like her using the victim card/system/powers of "must be believed at all cost" before any investigations is started. It takes just an accusation to destroy a man's life and career, so much so that when the evidence proves without any doubts that the man was innocent from the start and the woman played the "victim card" to forward her agendas, by then it's too late, the damages to the man's reputation/good name are done. 

This is why Amber Heard needs to get prosecuted to the full extent of the law in both criminal and civil courts, in order to send a clear and loud message that these kind of actions will not only be tolerated and must come with severe consequences no matter how high their ivory towers are.
author: S. Knight

comment: Seems to me like this was a very toxic relationship. More likely she started the physical violence and he reacted and did hit her back. This explains why his ex's didn't believe this happened. His exe's weren't toxic and abusive, so they wouldn't have ever seen that side of him. He is human and most people who do get hit will react. If not at first, then eventually you will snap. He may not want it to come out in court because it's harder for a man to be portrayed as a victim and he knows that. Even if she started it, its an uphill battle to prove it was self defence for him. Everyone has a right to defend themselves, but were in this weird transitional place where we as a culture haven't fully moved away from only women being victims of domestic abuse. Usually in these toxic environments both people become abusers by the end of it. Abuse isn't just physical either. It can be verbal and manipulation too. I think he also recognizes he should have handled things differently because now the dirty laundry will be out there. He isn't completely innocent and he knows that because it's impossible that one person is an innocent dove and the other is crazy. (Although we known she is the core start of the abuse) Usually the abuser changes the victim to be like them and both people become abusive. I do believe she has evidence of abuse, but she's trying to change the narrative of what really happened and not take ownership for instigating or abusing him too.

comment: Wicked. She's wicked. And at the end of that call she was scared. But only for herself. Her reputation. This is incredible. I fell for a guy who said he was unattached and for a short time we were both really into each other. Then his old girlfriend wrote him a letter from the county jail. She needed $10,000 bail. He showed me the letter and I said it's early in the game and I can walk away pretty easy at this time and not be too hurt. Though I really had fallen for him. We had become sexual by that time too. And had the talk about being monogamous and we both agreed to that. But I then asked him do I need to worry about you and her and he convinced me they were done. It went on way too long I'm embarrassed to admit. I feel lucky to be alive. She told people she was going to run me off the road into trees or over a bank. She was going to do all kinds of horrible things.  She had made threats to other women that came around too. Yeah, he was a player.  All water under the bridge now. I haven't seen or talked to him or anyone he associated with him in years. I moved about 30 miles away. Which is nothing to him if he wanted to see me. I quit calling him. I quit seeing him. I quit having anything to do with him.  He called after a couple of years and left messages just saying if I wanted to see him to give him a call. I never responded. It was hard for a little while but after all the sh*t I went through I'm glad I stopped it. Some people can't live without chaos and drama. It's all they know and it becomes their norm. A comfort zone. It's crazy but after about 50-55 years of it they don't even think about trying to change.  They or he couldn't even see a problem. I feel so free after that experience. Johnny isn't perfect because he's human. But damn he is a good man. I've always thought so and now I'll never doubt that. I don't know what he saw in her but that's his thing and I can't judge. Look  what I went through. I wish him the best and the best for his kids too. Amber will have to go poop in someone else's bed!

She just natters on and on and on, without breath - screeching and postulating.  She says, "Why did your divorce attorney get to file for a divorce, period... at all?"  Well, Um, ,,,What?? comment:
Listen, I know crazy. I absolutely know crazy. I've dated crazy women in my life, known crazy dudes and currently live next door to a woman named Amber that is 100% identical to Amber Heard in her craziness. It's uncanny.

Anyway, here is what Amber wants:

She wants to "win". She knows that public opinion is against her now and she KNOWS she can't go to court and win. She knows. Depp is telling her what she already knows.
The call here is to get Depp to make a public admission to her stories being true. She wants Depp to apologize for the things fake things "he has done" to her.

This avoids her being fully revealed as a psycho *AND* avoids becoming untouchable for future film roles. It makes her the victim. It also gives her a new platform within MeToo to raise her level of celebrity.

Her hand in getting Depp to agree to this? More lies and BS intimidation of "the clearest case the police have ever seen" and the general threat of *his* career being ruined. That's her hand. It's a pair of 3s at best and she has no idea that Depp has a royal flush. She knows his hand is really good so she's bluffing HARD here. 

That's it. It's a bluff. It's a call to coerce/bluff him into giving her the victory she actually wants. Notice how the only time she cries in any of the audio is when she's talking about the negatives in her career, how she was embarrassed within her career/reputation. Never about their lost marriage or hurting him. Her, her, her.

comment: Domestic violence survivors simply dont have all of this "evidence" that is one reason why it is so hard to prosecute.  They dont tend to have dates and times and corraboration because they dont know when things will happen and usually cant keep things like that stored as their abusers will find it.  People who are trying to make a case of something false make sure to take pertinent photos with time stamps and text as it can be saved etc.  Those things would only be able to happen if it was a concerted effort and if there was no risk of keeping all these documents because you are in no danger.,  At least this is usually true.  I dont know much about this case with them but I do know domestic violence and there is no way I could hav ekept one shred of evidence nor would I be discussing it with the perpetrator as I would be in fear of my life.  Fear of death and suffering and financial reasons are usually the reasons people stay in abusive relations and neither of those are a concern here apparently.  Now if you want to fabricate a series of false allegations then you would have all your "I"s dotted and your "t"s crossed since there is no threat

comment:
This breaks my heart. I can't believe he had to go through this- and after losing his mother, his wife, his fortune practically all in one week. 


I can't believe how beautiful and graceful a person he is. 


I can't believe I believed her. 


I can't believe what she's doing. I have a friend who's a victim of domestic abuse and these recordings show that Amber isn't. At all. Quite the opposite.


It's diabolical- the abuser accusing their victim of abuse as a way to control. Taking advantage of the important work of the MeToo and TimesUp movements and using it as cover. As a passionate believer in these movements and women's equality I am disgusted and horrified.


I read gossip websites and this is not being covered and I don't know why? Fear of litigation? Shame and embarrassment that we swallowed it, hook, line and sinker? If it's the latter, there's no excuse. She left human faeces on his bed, for chrissakes!!! 


Excuse me, I need to go and spend my money and time watching all Depp's films that I avoided for the last 5 years. It's the very least I can do.

comment: Yes Johnny Depp was a victim, and yet...wasn't he the one who recording these phone conversations? If ANY  person was intentionally entraping another person by recording them secretly, wouldn't that person naturally be expected to be on his or her their best behavior? I mean, from all the stuff I've heard it does indeed appear that Amber admits to faking being hurt to get him in trouble on the audio. But I think Mr. Depp seems so calm and rational perhaps because he knew he was being recorded? I'm not trying to defend Ms. Heard but how were these audio tapes obtained? If Depp recorded these conversations then don't you have to, at least to some extent, question the sincerity of his behavior, or whether his calmness and seeming rationality were in fact, acting? Please someone correct me if i'm wrong about this.

comment: This is so fucked up, to the point she wishes to be the face for all women out there who have been abused, when clearly she is the abuser and Johnny is the victim. Women like her make me sick and it only embarrasses me for being a woman. Unfortunately, men are also exposed to such abuse as women are. And equally, the abuser should suffer consequences for there actions irrespective of gender. It should not be tolerated nor supportive. So therefore, movie directors should take a strong stance on this and show zero tolerance towards the abuser, no matter how much of a monetary loss it maybe to drop them from a movie. All,actions have consequences, and this is the most crucial one of them all. It's unfair how Johnny can be dropped from being Captain Jack Sparrow (when clearly no other  person could ever portray this character quite like Johnny, for he IS  Captain Jack Sparrow, and no one will ever be as close to that.) So should Amber be accountable for her undeniable actions, for which she doesn't accept any responsibilities whatsoever for her actions, other than Johnny was the one who made her do it to him. Nobody asks to be abused, nor do they ever wish it upon themselves.Amber needs to stop playing the blame game, and learn to take responsibility for her actions. comment: I will say this, publicly. I am SO sorry for my feelings in the past two years regarding Johnny Depp. When this story first broke, I immediately took the viewpoint of "So many women are trapped and no one believes them, so I'm gonna give her the benefit of the doubt. He probably did it." And that view led me to hold resentment for him as an actor and celebrity, to the point where I rolled my eyes anytime he was mentioned. Now, catching up on the case. I am SO SORRY. For letting a good-natured benefit of the doubt turn into unfounded bias against an actual victim. This was certainly a lesson in the ability to let the pendulum swing too far the other way. True feminism is the ability to recognize that it's the VICTIMS we stand with, regardless of gender.

author: johnny marlin

comment:
this is by far the most devastating of the audio documents. this alone should suffice in any court in front of any jury to tell what was really going on here. oh my, the way he still after all this time tries to be constructive, patiently enduring all her gaslighting attempts, directly confronting her "do you really believe all this? do you think im an abuser?" (with her not being able to respond), but...  what a punch line, whats the thing that finally makes him give up and switch to "i will see you in court"? its when she suggests hed have leaked her previous stripper career. that he would break her trust. that seemingly minor detail ends up being the thing at the end that makes him angry enough to realize that hes been in love with a utopian version of her instead of actual her (what a breathtakingly accurate way to phrase it in the heat of the moment, btw).

it says so much about the man that its here that hes had enough. yet still even takers the time to point out that hed never tell anyone about this...compared to the other fantasy accusations, its almost ridiculous how far the overton window is moved and how laughably irrelevant this small detail looks in the big picture, but since this is the only accusation thats even within the realm of the possible, thats what finally sets him off. because standards. what a guy.

i really hope this ends asap. the whole he said she said thing with abuse is always such a difficult thing, but man, rarely have i ever heard of a case that is a clear as this one. actually, probably never before.

oh, and she is in serious need of professional help. narcissist, borderliner, one should avoid too specific speculation from afar, but man, she clearly has issues that go far beyond "shes just not a nice person", to put it mildly.

I don't know about others, but there is something deeply bothersome and annoying about the way she talks. I cannot believe that a man of Johnny's age and experience would fall in love with this immature, crazy, lying brat! I just don't know where his logic was throughout all this...It really says a lot that he would be with and forgive this human for so many years. 

Someone commented below that he truly was duped by her beauty and I 100% believe it because I just cannot fathom how anyone could put up with this. Just the way she is using like a sweet voice to sound endearing and victim-like and then when he gets angry and serious her real tone of voice comes out, where she says Stop, I just can't. I don't think I have ever been so disgusted by a fellow female the way I am right now. I really, really, really hope that he gets some better lawyers because to be honest, I didn't think his lawyer was doing such a good job with the interrogation questions either. This man needs justice!

comment: I just ended a 20-year marriage to a narcissist who was also, very likely, a sociopath ... listening to that conversation was a flashback and a half. I'm 6'4" 235# and, a martial artist. Who would believe that I was defenseless against a 185# 5'6" woman? My home life was so emasculating that even when I did gripe to a friend it was veiled in the lies I told myself to make it all okay. Gentle souls are little more than prey to these kinds of women. There are websites now on female on male pattern abuse ... look for them. There are also some great resources for people surviving the special kind of PTSD that comes from surviving a narcissist ... aptly dubed N-PTSD. Not all people are good; not even all women. comment:
This is the most obvious DV I've ever seen. I never even heard anything about any of this until my friend posted it on FB that his career was destroyed, hell I didn't even know he was married to Amber Heard.
He still loves her... why? Why do victims of DV always still love the attackers? My mom was a victim, he wouldn't hurt her as far as I ever saw but he would hurt me to hurt her, and force.... "force" her to hurt me too. Not in the same way!! Like, he would lock me in the basement, closets, ect, starve me, beat me, punch me, stab me [in the hand with pencils but also jab me in the back but not enough to do anything but hurt], press on bruises, and the one thing he did that my mom didn't know about [I think?] made me never be able to sleep on my back again, in fact I started sleeping under the bed or in the closet behind an old bed frame and mattress.
He kicked me out when I was 13. They were divorced I think the next year or the year after. My guess is he probably started abusing her in the same way he abused me every day for five years. And I say "force" earlier because she says that's why she abused me, even when he wasn't home....


And she said for years after that that she still loved him.

He started off as a good person and became a monster. That's why I don't want to get in a relationship [one of the reasons... I have autism which makes that stuff really hard], I'm worried either she or I will become monsters over time. Everyone says my moms husbands have always been the way they are and that I won't become like them, but I don't understand and don't want to take the chance.

comment:
@incredibly average, 
what with all the desensitizing information that has come out of the major media outlets in recent weeks...we need another one of your insightful and informative videos now more than ever! 
I've always been a huge movie buff and Johnny Depp is one of my favourite actors along with Joaquin Phoenix, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Daniel Day Lewis and others. I was always sure to enjoy a movie with one of these guys in it. 
When Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them was announced, the media was constantly talking about how Depp's involvement the movie was a terrible thing. By TRUSTING this misinformation, I concluded what anyone would/did: Johnny Depp is a despicable person. My view of him shifted immensely. Everytime I watched a movie with him in it, I could not stop thinking of what he was  accused of. In my mind it became him in a way.
What I'm trying to say with this comment is that I'm very grateful that people like you have the patience and determination to inform others like me who want to know the truth about this case by giving facts and untainted official documents as evidence to form their own point of view WITHOUT being forcefully lead in a certain direction by newspapers who's only interest is selling copies...and not inform the public. 
Many rely on your amazing work and I think I speak for many who has been following this case when I say 
THANK YOU!

comment:
This phone call shows she wants everything public. This is for her plans. I believe she planned all this...... to boost her fame, to make her known to the public. Years ago movie companies made people date or marry for various reasons. One is to get a lesser known actor/actress seen with a more famous star so that gets the lesser known person interested in by the public. The second of marriage was often used to hide the fact that an actor was gay. Like when rumors started, they arranged the marriage to squash the rumors. So I think years ago Amber decided she needed to do something to increase her fame. Although NORMAL PEOPLE think it is to way out there for anyone to do, it is still not out of the realm of possibilities. A lot of people frame out how to achieve future goals, so who is to say that she couldn't have done this but in a sinister way? We NORMAL PEOPLE sometimes think that people are not capable of something like this, but we also can't believe why serial killers do what they do, but they exist and what they do happens. Some people are MANIACAL and I believe Amber Heard is one of them!!!
 Just my thoughts on everything and just giving people something to think about. I'm glad his team is releasing things that prove who the true abuser is. This doesn't make Johnny Depp a weak man, it makes him a gentleman that knows when to walk away. Unlike Amber that refuses to let him leave when things get heated up.

comment: Cluster B Personality disorder. Textbook from Heard.  I lived with someone who was diagnosed as Borderline Personality Disorder.  The interpretation of events is radically different by the Cluster B.  The maladaptive coping mechanisms and a desire create a narrative that supports whatever she feels. Manufacturing evidence because they end up believing it and they sell it with sociopathic precision because they believe this fantasy construct to affirm their feelings along with zero acknowledgement of their behaviors.  Then there is the deflection from things she knows are true, to having to process and create an alternative narrative to avoid responsibility. That stone silence is her defense mechanism creating that deflection narrative.  Most importantly, I experienced firsthand that my ex would after a fight would go throw  themselves down the stairs to harm themselves.  Bloody knees, bruises.  I myself was one step away from a 911 call and "she pushed me."  The police wouldn't have thought twice and cuffed me. This is how the crazy affects the sane person and when you stand up to it or defend yourself, and I'm not even talking physically.  This 'I hate you,  don't leave me' cycle begins.   It's even more evident that when he walks away to cool things down, she goes ballistic.  They don't want you walking away leaving them with their own emotions all alone.  They need to take it out on other another - children, spouses.  Whoever they can.

author: Ashley H

comment:
I heard the moment when he finally accepted she is bat sh*t crazy. That 'oh my god'. You hear the penny finally drop. I know that because I've been there, that epiphany you get, the knowing that everything has been a lie, that a crazy person made you crazy too. Also sounds like, by the questions he asked, that he's been reading up on narcissistic personality disorder. He tied her in knots (metaphorically!), shook her out of her grandiose delusion for a few,sweet moments. A perfect gotcha moment. 

As abused people, we hope so hard that we can get thru to those that abuse us. We try everything. And then we have that moment when we know we are done. And we fight back. This is also when the narcissist knows they've been uncovered.  Unfortunately, this is when the narcissist can become more dangerous.

comment: Not that any of us know either of them... but every comment I've read is only siding with Johnny Depp. In the midst of dysfunctional relationships, each party does anything in retaliation whether or not it makes sense. Maybe she's making stuff up, maybe not. But in all honesty, hearing him tell her over and over again that he loves her and asking for this whole thing to just be settled between them and not through the courts, turning her stories back on her to talk about the one time he was badly injured, using reverse psychology to ask if she REALLY believes he's an abuser, sounds 100% like manipulation. (But for some reason, the only thing everyone is focusing on is the one part where Amber says no one would believe he's a DV victim... yet all *his* manipulative statements are overlooked? Hm. Also everyone's griping that she's concerned for her reputation as a public figure, but he clearly is too.) It is very easy for an abuser to suddenly collect themself and sound like the "good guy" when it matters. And keep in mind, he was the one recording this call. Of course he'd be on his best behavior to use this in his best interest.

comment:
I'm a bit confused. When the first audios came out, i was pissed off because it's clear that she hit him on multiple occasions. But in that particular audio, each time she was saying "you did this and that..." he never denied, not once. And i believe when someone is describing an action you didn't have, a gut reaction is "WHAT???" You don't respond saying nothing, just chilling. It looks like he is trying not to parjure himself by saying "what you are describing i did to you, did not happen". You can see it when she says he "gave them" the information she was a stripper, he has a gut reaction "I give them???", then lower his voice and just say "i see you in court".

He just said "Do you really believe i'm a abuser?" like the word is bothering him, like as he was reciprocating and she started it, this was not abusive as well.

I think she is an abuser, but i think Johnny even if he just reciprocated after his finger was injured (for example) cannot say "i didn't hit her".
The question is, when you never start it but just reciprocate, are you an abuser? And then the question will be, do you reciprocate with equal force and is it ok in anyway?
So the relationship was abusive and broken.



But she is at fault because she went to talk at the #metoo movement, implying Johnny abused her and was physically violent, causing harm to his reputation, his career and his family. They had settled this with an agreement, she broke it. Now the audios show that she was physical too and started the fights.

comment:
Unfortunately, women lying and making up allegations of rape and abuse is common place these days and is protected by the metoo movement. I am in no way saying that all women do this and that rape doesn‚Äôt occur because it does. But we are in a day and age where allegations are being made publicly, in many cases years after the fact with little to no evidence. And once it‚Äôs done, it‚Äôs ruined someone‚Äôs life before the allegations were investigated or that guilt was proven and that is obscene.  That‚Äôs not the way we should go about things.... It wasn‚Äôt always this way, but lately our culture is to automatically ruin someone‚Äôs life before establishing whether the accusation is true or not. And if it‚Äôs true, hey have at em, but if it‚Äôs not, then the accuser should be thrown in jail for ruining the persons life....

Many women tarnish the names and reputations of men with little to no evidence. That is not the way our system works.

comment:
This woman is clearly insane. I have always been on team Depp - I never believed he had ever abused her, after all, there were never any rumors of Johnny Depp being violent towards women. No one should ever be abused - not a woman nor a man though both are capable of being abusive. My issue with this whole situation is that Johnny Depp was 51 and Amber was 28 - a 23 year age gap. He
 is old enough to be her father and should be the mature one - or at least had the wisdom to have seen the red flags before he married her. She already had a record for committing domestic violence,    was/is confused about her sexuality (according to the press that was an issue in their marriage too),  and was probably abusive to him before the marriage. etc. Thank God, he finally woke up and realized that the image he had of her was a figment of his imagination. I support Johnny Depp 100% - I just wish he would find peace and comfort with someone more mature and mentally stable.

comment: Liars have no true experiences to draw from. I've noticed after listening to the clips that Heard has an extreme tendency to ramble on and on about vague topics because she can't give a straight answer, ever. In this video, Depp asks her, "You believe I'm an abuser?" Now if Heard was the "typical" abused wife who had the courage to stand up against her abuser, she may throw some words back into his face such as these: "Yes, like the time you ripped hair and scalp out of my head" (her words, not mine) or maybe "Yes, like the time you head-butted my face and busted my nose." But that's not what we get with Heard. She retaliates with, "In May. In December...in...in April." Wouldn't someone who truly experienced traumatic abuse naturally respond by recounting the very incidents that occurred, rather than state the months in which they occurred? Maybe that's just me overanalyzing. But, as I said, this Heard person never sounds genuine to me when she is "defending" herself. By the way, to the maker of these videos exposing Heard, I applaud you for following your good sense to cover a topic that is taboo to even touch upon in this toxic society we live in.

comment: An abuser both verbally and physically will always make you feel that all of it was your fault. Those things fed to you if you stay longer in the relationship will brainwash you and cause you to doubt yourself and slowly believe that yes it was your fault. That is why the cycle goes on for longer periods of time because you just got this reverse psychology from the abuser and starts believing that it was your fault that you triggered him/her and it was your fault you got hit because you deserve it and they only defended themselves. To break this, you need to be brave to stand up, make changes in your situation and share to people that will help you get out from the situation. I have seen many cycles of this. This is actually more of a psychological battle. Just sharing.
